metadata.Title: CVE-2022-2928 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: In ISC DHCP 4.4.0 -> 4.4.3, ISC DHCP 4.1-ESV-R1 -> 4.1-ESV-R16-P1, when thefunction option_code_hash_lookup() is called from add_option(), itincreases the option's refcount field. However, there is not acorresponding call to option_dereference() to decrement the refcount field.The function add_option() is only used in server responses to lease querypackets. Each lease query response calls this function for several options,so eventually, the reference counters could overflow and cause the serverto abort.

criterions.comment: isc-dhcp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
